thread.title: Three Atlanta kids in top 20 on Fox cooking show
thread.title_full: Three Atlanta kids in top 20 on Fox cooking show

author: Helena Oliviero
title: Three Atlanta kids in top 20 on Fox cooking show
text:
Three young chefs in Georgia have moved on to the top 20 in the fifth season of ‚ÄúMasterChef Junior‚Äù on Fox , airing on Thursday evenings.
They are among 40 talented kids between ages 8 and 13 who were selected from a nationwide search for the best junior home cooks across the country.
The three kids from Georgia include:
Jasmine Stewart, 12, of Milton, Justise Mayberry, 11, of Sugar Hill and Afnan Ahmad from Jonesboro.
RETWEET to congratulate the #MasterChefJunior Top 20! üéâ pic.twitter.com/JuihNMsMjy
‚Äî MasterChef Junior (@MasterChefJrFOX) February 17, 2017 The culinary competition features a series of delicious challenges ‚Äî from steak to scallops to cupcakes. They also cook a meal for more than 40 first responders, and get a culinary challenge from former first lady Michelle Obama. This season also includes the first-ever vegan challenge. Surprise guests and diners also include renowned chef Wolfgang Puck and the Muppets .
The host is Gordon Ramsay, British star chef of ‚ÄúHell‚Äôs Kitchen.‚Äù He is joined by renowned pastry chef Christina Tosi. Together, these food experts coach and encourage the hopefuls to cook like pros and teach them the tricks of the trade along the way.
One of the young chefs will be named the country‚Äôs newest MasterChef Junior and will take home a trophy ‚Äî and a $100,000 grand prize. The show will air Thursdays from 8-9 p.m. on Fox.
The Atlanta Journal-Constitution recently interviewed local contestants about their love of cooking and about being on the show, which was filmed in Los Angeles. They were not allowed to discuss the results. Here are excerpts from interviews with Jasmine and Justise.
Salad bar concept coming to Atlantic Station with plans to open 20 Atlanta locations
Jasmine Stewart, 12, of Milton is one of the 20 finalists in this season of MasterChef Junior on Fox. (Photo: CONTRIBUTED) The Atlanta Journal-Constitution Jasmine Stewart, 12, of Milton: Jasmine vividly remembers helping her mom make pancakes when she was 3 years old, and it didn‚Äôt get off to a great start.
She cracked an egg and it broke into many pieces, with the yolk and egg white and bits of shell spilling all over her. ‚ÄúBut my mom told me it was OK and we tried again, and it went well. And the pancakes turned out really great,‚Äù she said.
Jasmine said cooking provides an outlet for her to express herself and be creative. ‚ÄúI really enjoy cooking. It creates a free place for your mind and for me,‚Äù she said. Her favorite dishes to make include cupcakes, steaks, burgers and salad.
Jasmine said cooking provides an outlet for her to express herself and be creative. ‚ÄúI really enjoy cooking. It creates a free place for your mind and for me,‚Äù she said. Her favorite dishes to make include cupcakes, steaks, burgers and salad. Jasmine said she decided to audition after her mom heard about the search and local auditions at a hotel in Atlanta. She said the audition started with a lengthy interview and she was then asked to cook an egg on the spot. About the show: ‚ÄúI never would have dreamed I would make it to the top 40. It was wonderful to be in a competition doing something I love.‚Äù
Justise Mayberry, 11, of Sugar Hill: Justise remembers cooking with her dad as soon as she could reach the counter, and by age 9 her parents trusted her to slice vegetables with knives and use the stove.
She said one of her top priorities when cooking is to prepare healthy meals. For example, she incorporates many vegetables, including onions, peppers and carrots, into a shrimp and linguine meal, one of her favorite dishes.
About cooking, Justise said, ‚ÄúIt just makes me happy. It‚Äôs something that brings the family together and helps me not get bored.‚Äù
Being on the show has inspired her to prepare more ambitious dishes, she said. Since returning from filming the show, she recently made a steak dinner with Brussels sprouts, spinach and bacon. But this time, she made a bacon maple cream sauce to pour on top.
In the #MasterChefJunior kitchen, @GordonRamsay always has your back. Watch last night's episode here: https://t.co/QggXfvX2f1 pic.twitter.com/cBeESjqQkX
‚Äî MasterChef Junior (@MasterChefJrFOX) February 17, 2017 TV PREVIEW
‚ÄúMasterChef Junior,‚Äù 8-9 p.m. Thursdays, Fox
